text: today is Ghazwan P&L deviation of
worshop my daughter had graduated from
high school and my son from elementary
school and they went to the concert with
their friends to celebrate they both
suffered burns to 90% of their body my
daughter died two days later my son has
been in intensive care ever since
if the organisers had paid more
attention to safety so many young
people's lives wouldn't be ruined like
this here in Taiwan concerns over public
safety is at an all-time high after a
year of disasters people are starting to
not see them as an isolated incident but
instead as
metal bars over windows kill people in
house fires almost every year yet no
government has ordered residents to
dismantle them and even though a law
requires people to wear seat belts few
do and the police rarely find anyone for
violations despite injuries from traffic
accidents skyrocketing in recent years
so why is it that I want reply knives
and safety hazards and even when there
are laws they are rarely important
Taiwan seems modern but the public's
awareness about safety hasn't kept up
neither have the laws even when there
are laws people don't see the point of
following them and civil servants don't
actively enforce them politicians
respond only when something big happens
after each disaster change is demanded
following the fire at an illegally built
bowling alley that cured six
firefighters Taiwan boosted equipment
and training for firefighters the
government says it is responding to
calls for tighter safety laws but
enforcing them is a problem Mill thought
they sitting on dog we face obstacles
including local politicians who worry
they'll lose votes by enforcing the rule
but over the years we've done a lot to
educate and reduce the number of
incidents the government banned the
flammable color powder from being used
at events but many believe these are
just short-term fixes and that what's
really needed is Taiwanese society as a
whole
placing much greater importance on
safety Cindy Hsu BBC News Taipei
